description: The CodeBoarding system orchestrates a comprehensive code analysis and documentation generation workflow. It begins with the Application Orchestrator & Repository Manager initializing projects, managing code repositories, and detecting changes. This orchestrator leverages the Incremental Analysis Engine to optimize performance by caching and re-analyzing only modified code. The core intelligence resides in the LLM Agent Core, which uses large language models to interpret code and analysis results. The agent interacts with the codebase and static analysis data through the Agent Tooling Interface, which in turn queries the Static Code Analyzer for deep structural and behavioral insights. Finally, the LLM Agent's findings are passed to the Documentation & Diagram Generator to produce user-friendly documentation and visual architectural diagrams.

components.name: Application Orchestrator & Repository Manager
components.description: Manages the overall application lifecycle, including project initialization, repository operations (cloning, updating), change detection, and orchestrating the analysis workflow. It also handles the initial setup and environment configuration for the analysis tools.

components.name: Orchestration Engine
components.description: Acts as the central controller for the agentic pipeline. It validates CLI arguments, manages the high‑level workflow (Clone → Analyze → Document), and updates environment‑specific configurations like VS Code settings.

components.name: Repository & Change Manager
components.description: Manages the lifecycle of the target source code. It handles Git operations (cloning/checkout), applies exclusion filters (.gitignore), and performs structural diffing to identify modified components for incremental analysis.

components.name: Tool Registry & Installer
components.description: A plugin‑style registry that manages the lifecycle of Language Server Protocol (LSP) binaries and other static analysis tools. It handles platform‑specific dependency checks (e.g., NPM, VCPP) and automated installations.

components.name: Analysis Transformer
components.description: Normalizes raw output from various static analysis tools into a UnifiedAnalysisJson schema. It also calculates component hierarchies and generates Mermaid.js diagrams for visual documentation.

components.name: State Manager
components.description: Provides a persistence layer for job metadata, file hashes, and analysis results using DuckDB. It ensures that the system can recover from interruptions and track the status of long‑running documentation tasks.

components.name: Config Provider
components.description: Centralizes the loading and validation of system environment variables and LLM‑specific configurations (OpenAI, Anthropic, Ollama, etc.). It ensures that credentials and model parameters are correctly injected into the orchestrator.

components.name: Monitoring & Observability
components.description: A tracing framework specifically designed for LLM‑powered systems. It tracks token usage, execution costs, and step‑by‑step agentic reasoning, persisting telemetry for audit and debugging.

components_relations.relation: queries
triggers ingestion
compares hashes against persisted manifest
passes raw static analysis results
persists final structured analysis and job completion status

streams execution telemetry and LLM usage metrics

components.name: LLM Agent Core
components.description: The intelligent core responsible for driving the code analysis and documentation generation using large language models. It orchestrates agent workflows, manages interactions with various tools, and structures the analysis insights.

components.name: Agent Orchestration Engine
components.description: Coordinates the analysis workflow, manages agent lifecycles, and ensures full coverage of CFG clusters.

components.name: Specialized Semantic Agents
components.description: Task‑specific agents (Abstraction, Meta, Details) that perform targeted analysis of code components.

components.name: Prompt Management System
components.description: Decouples prompt engineering from logic, providing provider‑specific templates (OpenAI, Gemini, etc.).

components.name: Semantic Validation Engine
components.description: Cross‑references LLM interpretations with static analysis facts to ensure no clusters are missed or hallucinated.

components.name: LLM Infrastructure & Config
components.description: Manages provider configurations, API keys, and model initialization (Ollama, Anthropic, etc.).

components.name: Static Analysis & Cluster Utils
components.description: Provides utility methods for agents to map clusters to file sets and extract relevant code subgraphs.

components.name: Semantic Data Models
components.description: Defines the structured Pydantic schemas for LLM communication and final documentation output.

components.name: Dependency Discovery Service
components.description: Scans for manifest files (e.g., package.json) to provide ecosystem context to the agents.

components_relations.relation: delegates granular analysis tasks
retrieves task‑specific templates
fetches code snippets and subgraph data for context
validates LLM‑derived components against CFG facts
supplies initialized model clients for execution
serializes LLM responses into structured objects
provides high‑level project metadata to seed the analysis

components.name: Static Code Analyzer
components.description: Performs deep structural and behavioral analysis of the codebase across multiple programming languages. It extracts information like call graphs, code structure, and identifies code quality issues, including unused code.

components.name: Static Analysis Orchestrator
components.description: The central entry point that manages the lifecycle of analysis runs. It coordinates project discovery, determines the programming languages present, and triggers the incremental update logic to minimize processing time.

components.name: LSP Protocol Handler
components.description: Manages low-level communication with Language Servers. It abstracts JSON-RPC messaging, document synchronization, and provides a mixin-based approach for resolving semantic references across files.

components.name: Language Specialists
components.description: Concrete strategies that handle the nuances of specific languages and their build systems (e.g., Maven, Gradle, tsconfig). They provide the necessary environment bootstrapping for the LSP servers.

components.name: Incremental State Manager
components.description: Optimizes performance by tracking changes in the codebase. It uses Git history to identify modified files and manages a local cache to ensure only affected components are re-analyzed.

components.name: Graph & Abstraction Engine
components.description: The "brain" of the subsystem that constructs a global Call Graph from raw symbols. It applies adaptive clustering to group low-level code elements into high-level architectural modules.

components.name: Code Quality Analyzer
components.description: A composite engine that runs diagnostic checks. It identifies structural flaws such as circular dependencies, "God Classes," and dead code, contributing to the overall health score of the project.

components.name: Analysis Data Store
components.description: Manages the persistence of all analysis outputs. It defines unified Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) that allow both the VS Code UI and LLM agents to query the results of the static analysis.

uses
feeds
provides
pushes
updates

components.name: Agent Tooling Interface
components.description: Provides a set of specialized tools that allow the LLM Agent Core to interact with the codebase, query static analysis results, and perform specific actions within the project context.

components.name: Tool Registry & Orchestrator
components.description: Acts as the central factory and dispatcher; it aggregates all specialized tools into a unified interface, managing tool registration and lifecycle for the LLM Agent.

components.name: Static Analysis Engine
components.description: Extracts high-level code intelligence, including Control Flow Graphs (CFG), class hierarchies, and method signatures to provide structural understanding.

components.name: File System & Source Access
components.description: Provides low-level access to the project's physical structure, enabling directory exploration and granular file content retrieval.

components.name: Dependency & Ecosystem Mapper
components.description: Maps internal package relationships and identifies external library dependencies to define the project's architectural boundaries.

components.name: Documentation & Git Context Provider
components.description: Retrieves non-code context, such as Markdown documentation and Git diffs, to provide historical grounding and design intent.

components.name: Infrastructure & State Manager
components.description: Manages repository-level state, including the DuckDB metadata store, caching mechanisms, and global ignore-pattern enforcement.

components_relations.relation: dispatches complex code queries to specialized extractors
requests raw file data or directory listings
queries the metadata store and cache
utilizes class and package info to build high-level dependency graphs
consults ignore-pattern enforcement
uses file discovery to locate relevant files

components.name: Incremental Analysis Engine
components.description: Optimizes analysis performance by managing the caching of static analysis results and orchestrating re-analysis only for changed parts of the codebase, ensuring efficiency and speed.

components.name: Incremental Update Orchestrator
components.description: Central controller (IncrementalUpdater) that manages the update lifecycle, deciding between patching, re‑expansion, or full re‑analysis.

components.name: Static Analysis Cache Manager
components.description: Manages the AnalysisCache, acting as the source‑of‑truth for call graphs, class hierarchies, and previous diagnostics.

components.name: Structural Change Analyzer
components.description: Evaluates differences (ClusterChangeAnalyzer) between iterations to classify changes (SMALL/MEDIUM/BIG) and map file diffs to architectural impacts.

components.name: Agentic Re‑expansion Engine
components.description: LLM‑driven component that re‑synthesizes descriptions and relationships for "dirty" components using meta‑agents.

components.name: File & Path Patching Service
components.description: Handles low‑level state updates such as file renames and deletions that do not require LLM intervention.

components.name: Incremental Persistence Layer
components.description: Provides thread‑safe I/O (_AnalysisFileStore) for atomic loading and saving of root and sub‑analysis fragments.

components.name: Integrity Validator
components.description: Performs post‑update consistency checks on the merged call graph and component mappings to prevent state corruption.

components_relations.relation: triggers analysis to define UpdateAction
invokes engine when changes exceed SMALL threshold
streams updated component fragments to persistence layer
directly modifies cache's file‑to‑component mappings
inspects final state of cache before update completion

components.name: Documentation & Diagram Generator
components.description: Transforms the processed analysis data and insights into user-friendly documentation formats (e.g., Markdown, HTML) and generates visual representations like architectural diagrams.

components.name: Output Orchestration Dispatcher
components.description: The central controller that receives the final analysis manifest and routes data to the appropriate output generators based on user-defined configurations (e.g., `--format html,markdown`).

components.name: Visual Model Generator
components.description: The engine responsible for translating static analysis relationships into graph‑based syntax. It generates the raw Mermaid.js strings and Cytoscape JSON structures used by the providers.

components.name: Interactive HTML Provider
components.description: Generates standalone, interactive web documentation. It embeds Cytoscape.js for dynamic diagram manipulation and manages CSS/JS assets for the UI.

components.name: Static Markdown Provider
components.description: Produces Markdown and MDX files optimized for static hosting (GitHub, Docusaurus). It embeds Mermaid.js code blocks for native rendering.

components.name: Sphinx Documentation Provider
components.description: A specialized generator that produces ReStructuredText (RST) files, allowing the tool's output to be seamlessly integrated into existing Python Sphinx documentation suites.

Orchestrator initiates analysis workflow, leveraging incremental updates based on detected code changes.
Orchestrator passes project context and triggers the main analysis workflow for the LLM Agent.
Incremental engine requests static analysis for specific code segments (new or changed).
Static analyzer provides analysis results to the incremental engine for caching.
LLM Agent invokes specialized tools to interact with the codebase and analysis data.
Agent tools query the static analysis engine for detailed code insights.

LLM Agent delivers structured analysis insights for documentation and diagram generation.
